topic.title: Intolerance Condition Log Entry - conformance rules

section.p: This class contains a history of updates to the Intolerance Condition record, and relates the Intolerance Condition record to various encounters over time. For example, if a patient's allergy becomes known for the first time, either through patient reporting it or the clinician directly observing it, an Intolerance Condition Entry record would be created with a status of "Active" along with an Intolerance Condition Log Entry record with a status of "New". The Intolerance Condition Log Entry links to the Encounter during which this action took place. If subsequently the allergy is revised, say to a narrower ingredient than previously supposed, or even to dismiss the notion that the allergy existed, a new Intolerance Condition Log Entry record would be created with a status of "Modified" or "Inactivated" and the Intolerance Condition Entry status would be set to "Active" or "Inactivated", respectively.

ol.li: Contains zero or one [0..1] comment with data type String

Contains exactly one [1..1] entryDate with data type Point In Time
The date and time that the Intolerance Condition Log Entry record was created.
"The date and time that this allergy was last statused by the [Intolerance Condition Log Entry Author] in the [Intolerance Condition Log Entry Service Delivery Location]" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-20. "The date and time that this allergy was inactivated by the [Intolerance Condition Log Entry Author]." - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-22. "The date and time that this allergy entry was created by the [Intolerance Condition Log Entry Author]." - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-24. "The date and time that this allergy was modified by the [Intolerance Condition Log Entry Author]" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-26.

Contains exactly one [1..1] status with data type Code
"Contains the current status of the problem at this particular date/time (e.g., active, active-improving, active-stable, active-worsening, inactive, resolved, etc.)." - HL7 Version 2.8, PRB-14
Contains the status of the Health Concern as of the Health Concern Log Entry record creation date. This provides a history of status changes over time.

Contains exactly one [1..1] author, where its type is Author
"Identifies the provider who assigned the clinical status to the allergy" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-18. "Identifies the user that inactivated the record entry about the patient's allergy" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-21. "Identifies the user that created the entry in the record stating the allergy" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-23. "Identifies the user that modified the allergy" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-25.

Contains zero or one [0..1] dataEnterer, where its type is Data Enterer
Identifies the data enterer of the Health Concern Entry Log. Data Enterer = "A person entering the data into the originating system. The data entry person is collected optionally for internal quality control purposes. This includes the transcriptionist for dictated text." - HL7 V3

Contains zero or one [0..1] visit, where its type is Encounter Event
"Uniquely identifies the episode of care to which this problem applies." - HL7 Version 2.8, PRB-5

Contains zero or one [0..1] reason with data type Code
Indicates the reason why the status of the associated Intolerance Condition record was changed.

Contains zero or one [0..1] serviceDeliveryLocation, where its type is Service Delivery Location
"Contains the name of the organization providing the update to the allergy" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-19. "Contains the name of the organization that initially recorded the allergy" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-28. "Contains the name of the organization that modified the allergy" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-29. "Contains the name of the organization that inactivated the allergy" - HL7 Version 2.8, IAM-30.
